optimTFE 1.0.0

Generate Multiple Solutions as a Data Frame

Source: R/RcppExports.R
solutions_gen_df.Rd

This function iterates over solution_ids, calls `solution_gen` for each ID, and combines all results into a single data frame. The solution generation process implements a greedy algorithm that iteratively selects planning units with high species richness to satisfy species targets across subregions.

Usage

solutions_gen_df(
  solution_ids,
  suitability,
  spp_targets,
  unit_regions,
  unit_counts,
  regional_min,
  regional_max,
  populations,
  population_counts,
  single_pu_pop,
  rand_tolerance,
  max_spp_selected,
  spp_names,
  seed,
  incompat = NULL
)

Arguments

solution_ids

IntegerVector of solution IDs. One solution will be generated for each ID provided.

suitability

NumericMatrix of species suitability scores, with planning units as rows and species as columns.

spp_targets

IntegerVector of target populations for each species.

unit_regions

IntegerVector mapping planning units to their respective regions.

unit_counts

IntegerMatrix of unit counts by species and region.

regional_min

IntegerMatrix of minimum targets for each species by region.

regional_max

IntegerMatrix of maximum targets for each species by region.

populations

IntegerMatrix specifying known populations for each species in each planning unit.

population_counts

IntegerMatrix of population counts by species and region.

single_pu_pop

Logical flag indicating whether only one unit should be selected per known population (default = TRUE).

rand_tolerance

Integer specifying the range of species richness from maximum to consider for selection at each iteration (default = 5).

max_spp_selected

Integer maximum number of species to select in each location to reduce 'species packing' within units. Use -1 for no limit.

spp_names

CharacterVector of species names.

seed

Unsigned 64-bit integer seed for random number generation.

incompat

Optional IntegerMatrix specifying species incompatibilities, where 1 indicates two species cannot share the same planning unit.

Value

A data frame with columns: solution, order, unit_id, passing, and one column per species indicating which species targets are satisfied in each planning unit.
